Summary My job business experiences includes various areas such as Design Engineering, Product Engineering, Validation and Technical Marketing. Past experience and current scope consists of working directly with vendors to help assure the products manufactured for employer meet design spec, budget limits, budget and product delivery timelines, warranty requirements and post production support needs. For the technical end of the job, my requirements are to research and develop product technical specifications, cost estimations, schematic and layout reviews, and design, path finding aiming at reducing costs, develop product validation requirements as well as develop training programs and documents to standardize across groups to increase efficiency. Summary I graduated from The Hebrew University of Jerusalem in 2011, earning a B.Sc in Computer Engineering and Applied Physics - Microelectronics. 
 
This degree has given me extensive knowledge in both analog and digital electronics, in addition to a firm background in the physics of semiconductor devices, solid state physics, and electro-optics. 
 
My final year project consisted of designing and constructing a model of a rectangular compartment, capable of recharging batteries wirelessly regardless of their spatial orientation inside. This project was awarded the Peter Brojde Award for Excellence.
